column2: SD DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column6: SD

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column6: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.

column2: 2. Roads are most slippery:
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column6: Do not enter
column8: Do not pass on the left.

column2: 4. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column6: go to the next entrance ramp.
column8: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column6: Railroad Warning

column2: 6. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column6: quickly change speed or lane position.

column2: 7. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column6: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column8: always sound their horn and stay alert.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column6: Lane reduction - the right lane ends soon
column8: Lane reduction - the left lane ends soon

column2: 9. A bad car suspension can cause:
column6: pumping brakes.

column2: 10. A broken white line:
column4: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column6: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column8: marks the right edge of the roadway.

column2: 11. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column6: Destination signs (guide signs)

column2: 12. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column6: red lights.

column2: 13. When driving in fog, you should never use your high beams because:
column4: vehicles behind you may follow too closely.
column6: oncoming vehicles might not see you.
column8: the light will reflect back into your eyes.

column2: 14. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column6: round.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers are about to enter a one way street the wrong way
column6: U-turns are prohibited
column8: Drivers may proceed if the way is clear

column2: 16. When changing lanes, drivers should never:
column4: glance over their shoulder to check for blind spots.
column6: change lanes abruptly.
column8: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 17. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column6: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.
column8: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.

column2: 18. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
column6: A reflective white triangle

column2: 19. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column6: the road is narrower ahead.

column2: 20. You should always travel:
column6: at the speed of the vehicle behind.
column8: according to weather and road conditions.

column2: 21. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.
column6: when a child is about to run into the street.

column2: 22. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column6: Pedestrian crossing ahead

column2: 24. Collisions can happen more often when:
column4: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.
column6: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.
column8: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.

column2: 25. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column4: if you have the green light.
column6: on the opposite side of the street.
